description: Get a media file from the WhatsApp service. On successful completion the media file is retrieved from Meta and stored in the specified Amazon S3 bucket. Use either destinationS3File or destinationS3PresignedUrl for the destination. If both are used then an InvalidParameterException is returned.

parameters.name: mediaId
parameters.description: The unique identifier for the media file.

parameters.name: originationPhoneNumberId
parameters.description: The unique identifier of the originating phone number for the WhatsApp message media. The phone number identifiers are formatted as phone-number-id-01234567890123456789012345678901. Use GetLinkedWhatsAppBusinessAccount to find a phone number's id.

parameters.name: destinationS3PresignedUrl
parameters.description: The presign url of the media file. The presign url to the object. A map of headers and their values. You must specify the Content-Type header when using PostWhatsAppMessageMedia. For a list of common headers, see Common Request Headers in the Amazon S3 API Reference (string) --- (string) ---

nested_params.name: url
nested_params.description: The presign url to the object.

nested_params.name: headers
nested_params.description: A map of headers and their values. You must specify the Content-Type header when using PostWhatsAppMessageMedia. For a list of common headers, see Common Request Headers in the Amazon S3 API Reference.

parameters.name: destinationS3File
parameters.description: The bucketName and key of the S3 media file. The bucket name. The object key of the media file.

nested_params.name: key
nested_params.description: The object key of the media file.

nested_items.name: mimeType
nested_items.description: The MIME type of the media.

nested_items.name: fileSize
nested_items.description: The file size of the media, in KB.
